snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo gets strong marks for his response to the Ebola virus. But some voters are unsettled by what they view as his back-room, bullying style and by a federal investigation.
abstract: New Yorkers have had four years to size up the policies, personality and governing tendencies of Gov Andrew M Cuomo, and they appear ready to give him a comfortable re-election victory over Republican challenger Rob Astorino; interviews with voters show that New Yorkers’ relationship with their governor is hardly warm or enthusiastic, despite broad agreement with his policies.

byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan and Tatiana Schlossberg contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo gets strong marks for his response to the Ebola virus. But some voters are unsettled by what they view as his back-room, bullying style and by a federal investigation.

headline.main: A Tepid Thumbs Up Is the Best Many Can Muster for Cuomo
headline.print_headline: A Tepid Thumbs Up Is the Best Many Can Muster for Cuomo
